intro: Ipomopsis tenuifolia, commonly known as slenderleaf trumpetflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky slopes and dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, contributing to its drought-resistant nature. Ipomopsis tenuifolia plays a role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies with its nectar-rich blooms.
